intro: Beaufortia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable beaufortia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, often variable leaf shapes, which can range from linear to ovate, depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers during the winter months. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. Beaufortia heterophylla is well adapted to drought and can thrive in sandy or gravelly soils.
